From: anas elghafari <anas.elghafari@...>
Subject: Is this a bug? Terminating a crawl job doesn't reduce CPU usage!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=422010605


--000325557c861ae783047a8f7c0c
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hi there,

I am running Heritrix on a Mac, I run an experiment to see how much CPU does
Heritrix take (using MacOS Activity Monitor). While launching Heritrix's WUI
and setting up a job, the CPU usage is about 4%. Strting a crawl job with
several seeds quickly raises CPU usage to about 99%. However, pausing the
crawl job does NOT reduce the CPU usage. Even more surprisingly, terminating
a crawl job does not reduce the CPU usg. Only when Heritrix WUI is shut down
does the CPU usage return to it was before the crawl job was started.

Is this a known issue? Am I doing something wrong?

Anas

--000325557c861ae783047a8f7c0c
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
